Articles.Content:
KASA is Proud to present...

The World War K Showcase

The World War K Hangar!!!

 

Spoiler

T-100

Col. Valentina Kerman instructs 2nd Lt. Bryson "Buck" Kerman over the Sea of Kerbin. Copyright KASA, 2017

Designed as a light training craft, the T-100 is used in both military training and civilian life as transport and crop-dusting. Powered by one propeller engine, the craft is a prime choice for the early stages of pilot training. The craft is not as maneuverable or fast as most fighters of the current day, but it is stable, managing to hold high-g turns without faltering.

 

STATS

Crew: 2 Defenses: None
Engines: 1x Propeller Engine Uses: Training, Civilian Use
Top Speed: 160m/s Parts: 36

KerbalX: https://kerbalx.com/Darkowl57/T-100-Trainer

Spoiler

T-200

2nd Lt. Triop Kerman flies over the KSC Island on a training mission. Copyright KASA, 2017

Built to be a light craft for training, this craft is used to show trainees how jet engines differ from turboprop engines. (The forums screwed me over, and I'm not putting stats on here; check KerbalX)

KerbalX: https://kerbalx.com/Darkowl57/T-200-Jet-Trainer

Spoiler

T-500

2nd Lt.Tarkin Kerman prepares for landing. Copyright KASA, 2017

Designed to show trainees the mechanics of afterburners, the T-500 excels in speed, maneuverability, and stability.

KerbalX: https://kerbalx.com/Darkowl57/T-500-Afterburning-Trainer

Spoiler

F-34C/D

2nd Lt. Danny Kerman lifts off from the KSC. Copyright KASA, 2017

2nd Lt. Jack Kerman uses the RCS thrusters to lift off on a training exercise. Copyright KASA, 2017

The F-34 program is made of 4 parts. The F-34A is a CTOL Fighter, the F-34B is a VTOL Striker, the F-34C is a CTOL Trainer with no weapons, and the F-34D is a VTOL Trainer with no weapons. With RCS and Gimbal active on the F-34C, the craft is highly unstable, but the entire F-34 program has an incredible stall speed at around 25 to 30m/s.

KerbalX (C): https://kerbalx.com/Darkowl57/KASA-F-34C

KerbalX (D): https://kerbalx.com/Darkowl57/KASA-F-34D

Spoiler

T-1300

Col. Valentina Kerman leads an air patrol in UK airspace. Copyright KASA, 2017

The T-1300 is a light concept fighter, with it's younger brother, the F-21 Blue Jay, being a combat aircraft. The -1300 is used for the final part of primary training, with tradition being for the instructor to take the top 2 pilots in the class on an air patrol in the bird.

KerbalX: https://kerbalx.com/Darkowl57/T-1300-Single-Cockpit-Jet-Trainer-Weaponized

 

World War K Combat Craft (KASA)

Spoiler

F-21 Blue Jay

Production Model 1385X lifts off from KSC on final tests. Copyright KASA, 2017

Built off of the T-1300 Training craft, the F-21 is armed with 1 gun, and 4 Heat-Seeking missiles. The bird, which is fast, stable, and efficient, is favored by pilots and tacticians for escort missions, air patrols, and interceptions.

KerbalX: https://kerbalx.com/Darkowl57/KASA-F-21-Blue-Jay

Spoiler

F-105 Sparrow

Col. Valentina Kerman flies in an airshow over the KSC. Copyright KASA, 2017

Built to be a long-range fighter, the Sparrow is a fast and stable fighter able to reach speeds above mach. Favored by most pilots, the craft is used for any needs the airforce has.

KerbalX: https://kerbalx.com/Darkowl57/F-105-Sparrow

Spoiler

F-34A

Col. Valentina lifts off from the KSC on a practice mission. Copyright KASA, 2017

Built to be a concept fighter, the F-34A utilizes a high-maneuverability, high-speed package to fight almost any target in range. The fighter is preferred by many pilots due to it's incredibly low takeoff and stall speed.

KerbalX:https://kerbalx.com/Darkowl57/KASA-F-34A

Spoiler

F-34B

Lt. Col. Haydi Kerman prepares for a practice engagement at the KSC. Copyright KASA, 2017

The F-34B is the second part of the F-34 program, and is a ground-attack assault VTOL, with 1 Vulcan turret on the inside, 4 Maverick missiles and 2 Hydra rocket pods. The craft is favored by many for a low stall speed and a great weapons payload.

KerbalX: https://kerbalx.com/Darkowl57/KASA-F-34B

Spoiler

K-22 Raptor

Col. Maxxy Kerman lifts off from KSC on a bombing run against the HAWX terrorist group. Copyright KASA, 2016

The K-22 is the most elite fighter of the modern day with an ECM jammer, countermeasures, and high speed. The 2 afterburning engines at the rear of the craft produce incredible thrust and speed, and the gimbal allows for incredible maneuverability.

KerbalX: https://kerbalx.com/Darkowl57/K-22-Raptor

Spoiler

F-15A/B Eagle

F-15 on a simulator flight. Weapons have been expended to test maneuverability. Copyright KASA, 2017

F-15B lifting off from the KSC on an attack of a HAWX stronghold. Copyright KASA, 2017

The F-15 program is a maneuverable aircraft that has high speed and control. The craft is known to have too much maneuverability though, and has been shown to have a problem dubbed by pilots as "Super-Stall," where the engine gimbal produces too much maneuverability and the plane can stall.

KerbalX (A): https://kerbalx.com/Darkowl57/F-15A-Fighter-Eagle

KerbalX (B): https://kerbalx.com/Darkowl57/F-15B-Attacker-Eagle

Spoiler

F-19

Capt. Davis Kerman takes off from KSC on an escort mission. Copyright KASA, 2017

The F-19 fighter, with a concept wing shape and payload, is a fast and maneuverable fighter, even with a full weapons payload and max fuel. The original F-19 was far too maneuverable, leading to stalls and flat spins. However, after removing the gimbal from the craft and taking off the front canards, the F-19 is now a stable and complex fighter.

KerbalX: https://kerbalx.com/Darkowl57/F-19

Spoiler

I-900 Wasp

Corp. Bertrid Kerman supercruises over the KSC mountains. Copyright KASA, 2017

The I-900 Wasp is a light interceptor with incredible maneuverability and speed, like its namesake. The single-crewed plane is also single-engined, with a unique fuel tank extension that not only serves as the mount for the vertical stabilizers, the horizontal stabilizers, and the landing gear, but looks awesome. Able to get up to Mach 3, this plane is favored by pilots for chasing supersonic bombers outside of airspace.

KerbalX: https://kerbalx.com/Darkowl57/I-900-Wasp-Interceptor

Spoiler

A-11 Boar

Enough said.

Have you had your daily dose of bbbbbbbrrrrrrrttt? Do you feel a need to wipe something off the face of the earth? Do you want to deliver over 4000 pounds of explosive freedom? Do you want to shoot a 30mm cannon to fulfill the needs of question #1? Then get the A-11 Boar! Guaranteed to make you look awesome and feel great.

KerbalX: https://kerbalx.com/Darkowl57/A-11-Boar

 

Edited June 12, 2017 by DarkOwl57
Nice work, great pictures.

8 minutes ago, Triop said:

Nice work, great pictures.

 

More to come; I've got the F-34A/B, a K-4, a K-22, maybe an F-15, and a couple specialty crafts from moi

Are you taking submissions? Because I've got a small, fast interceptor with great handling, and you don't appear to have a plane of that role. Right now it's loaded with stock bombs and missiles, but you could easily swap them for BDA weapons. The planes look great though!

12 hours ago, MiffedStarfish said:

Are you taking submissions? Because I've got a small, fast interceptor with great handling, and you don't appear to have a plane of that role. Right now it's loaded with stock bombs and missiles, but you could easily swap them for BDA weapons. The planes look great though! 

Yeah sure! Any crafts that get submitted will probably be used by the other nations, but go for it! Can't wait to see your planes

<takes deep breath> 

I have the backbone of my airforce, the AS-1 Wasp, which I don't have pictures of right now, sorry. It's a compact single engine highly manoeuvrable fighter/interceptor that, similar to the IRL F4U Corsair, was originally intended to have carrier capability, but was deemed inadequate for use with the new flagship of the navy, the ASC-1 Floating Fortress. Now it makes up the majority of my airforce, based on land. I'll get pictures and a download up tomorrow.

As the lack of fighters able to operate of the very expensive Floating Fortress looked bad, a new fighter was built from the ground up for carrier use, the AS-2 Vulture.

The special thing about the vulture though, is it's rotating engine, giving it single engine VTOL capabilities.

Though transitioning between modes can be finicky, it is very reliable, and has not failed on me yet after a solid hour of testing. As the fighter was built around the swivelling engine, sacrifices were made to range and  firepower.

Ignore the flagpole, it was a fluke... 

once again, I will have downloads tomorrow.

And finally, if you want some sort of enemy flagship to use as a focus, I have the ASC-1 Floating Fortress.

It is a stock supercarrier capable of storing up to 12 AS-2 Vulture fighters, but the recommended limit is 6. The part count is 650, so practical for use. Once again, I will have downloads tomorrow.

Very nice! I have a question; which nation would you like to send these crafts to? There's United Kerbin (The main nation), Klathu, Veloxia, Kerthenia, Kruola, Agonarch Imperium, the Territorial Arid Protection Entente, the United States of Kerbolia, Slavisnia, the Jesalian Empire, Dystrios, Penguinia, and Petlof.

Also, the next plane, the F-19 is on the way; I'm adding weapons and making minor tweaks to the design

EDIT: Nevermind; KSP crashed.. Give me about 10 minutes to load KSP back, 5 minutes to get the pics and 5 hours to get KerbalX up

I've had an idea. So you can submit 3 classes of tanks, 5 classes of ships, and 5 classes of planes.

Tank classes

- Light Tank

- Medium Tank

- Heavy Tank

Ship Classes

- Submarine

- Destroyer

- Cruiser

- Battleship

- Aircraft Carrier

Plane Classes (Note: Planes can have variants (i.e. F-15A and F-15B) and one plan can serve multiple purposes (Fighter & Interceptor))

- Interceptor

- Fighter

- Attacker (A fighter with bombs)

- Bomber

- Carrier plane (Any type goes; as long as it can take off within 50-100 meters)

In the plane class, in order to make it fair, the Whiplash engine can be used ONLY on the interceptor class.

Edited June 11, 2017 by DarkOwl57

Alright, so all the fighters for the KASA have been built! I've decided to leave out the K-4 (Sorry all you F-4 fans) because I'm really just ready to show off the rest of the planes before going to tanks. On to the rest of the planes!

Wait, let's see... https://mega.nz/#!93RSFYDK!oC1VKbVzPXf_7gN5wsjixQ5LjbhwaDrnNuRCRgivd50
@MiffedStarfish, don't be too mad...... Buuuuuuuuutttttt.... I used your VTOL for inspiration in the I-900.......

Here are the downloads of my ships, all are in 1.2.2 and currently kitted out with stock missiles, but it should be easy to convert them to BDA. Quick question, what actually IS world war K? As for nation, I don't mind, but would it be possible to have F-Tech as a company that supplies their military? Like, for example, as the F-35 Lightning II is known as the Lockheed Martin F-35 Lightning II, therefore keeping the F-Tech designation prefix.

Fighter/Attacker - F-Tech AS-1 Wasp

An AS-1 Wasp taking off with afterburner engaged, piloted by Erianna Kerman of the 3rd Squadron

A Wasp flying patrol over a city on the coast, captured by the pilot's wingman

A cheap, reliable and compact attack fighter, the AS-1 Wasp makes up the backbone of F-Tech's Air Force. Capable of air superiority and ground attack missions, it has earned the nickname "Thingbuster", as it busts just about anything you point it at. With excelllent manoeuvrability and enough wing space to hold up to three (or more) missiles or bombs on each wing, its capable of dealing out a significant punch, as well. Due to limitation in deck space, it cannot operate on carrriers, and is used solely from land based airfields. It does however, have significantly more range than the AS-2, so it can still go on ship convoy attack missions.

Specifications 

Parts: 98 (62 with weapons removed)

Mass: 15 tons

Top Speed: 200m/s without afterburner, 350 with

Crew: 1 Pilot

Weapons: 2 guided Air to Air missiles, 2 Ore tank bombs (in stock)

Cost: 90,000 funds

Notes and Action Groups

SAS should be on at all times.

Action groups

1-Toggle Panther Engine

2-Toggle Afterburner

Download: https://www.dropbox.com/s/8plj731tv2igahi/F-Tech AS-1 Wasp.craft?dl=0

 

Carrier Fighter - F-Tech AS-2 Vulture

An AS-2 Vulture on a test flight, after switching to horizontal flight mode

An AS-2 During a military parade, showcasing its ability to hover in place and conduct ground attacks

Built from the ground up for use in conjunction with the Floating Fortress Class and any other aircraft carriers, the AS-2 Vulture is the pinnacle of F-Tech's aerial technology. Its main feature is its rotating engine, allowing it seamlessly transition from VTOL to horizontal flight. This function optimises it for carrier use, and gives it the capability of orbiting a target or holding a point. The plane was built around the engine assembly though, and some sacrifices had to be made in range and speed, giving it an effective operating range of 100 kilometres, with liberal use of the Afterburner.

Specifications

Parts: 125 (85 with weapons removed)

Mass: 11 tons

Top Speed: 150m/s Without afterburner, 250m/s with

Crew: 1 Pilot

Range: 100km

Cost: 100,000 funds

Notes and Action Groups

To switch between flight modes, decouple the engine asssembly with action group 3, switch to it, and pitch up or down depending on which mode you're switching to. It can be fiddly, but the mechanism is very reliable, I'm yet to have a failure. When switching modes, you will lose about 150m of altitude, so I recommend not switching if you are less than 300m up. The docking port on the bottom of the engine is used for the VTOL configuration and carrier storage, there are corresponding ports on the deck of the Floating Fortress to refuel the fighters with, and they can only be attached to with the engine in horizontal mode.

Action Groups

1-Toggle Panther Engine

2-Toggle Afterburner

3-Toggle flight mode (decouples engine assembly)

Download: https://www.dropbox.com/s/jdxovwa5nwwfla8/F-Tech AS-2 Vulture.craft?dl=0

 

Aircraft Carrier - F-Tech ASC-1 Floating Fortress

The ASC-1 Floating Fortress during its sea trials

An AS-2 Vulture rises off the deck with engine in VTOL configuration

The first of the Floating Fortress Class of carrier, the ASC-1 can sustain a squadron of 6 AS-2 Fighter/Attacker Hybrid VTOLs, with one spare aircraft if one is damaged or shot down. It can defend itself from attacks with its 4 anti-air missiles. All in all, it allows whichever nation fortunate to command a ship of its Class to park a small airfield of the coast of an enemy country, and suppress them from the air.

Specifications 

Parts: 630 (532 with weapons removed)

Mass: 450 tons

Top speed: 25 knots (13m/s)

Crew: 10 (Fleet Admiral Hayma Kerman, 3 mechanics, 6 pilots)

Aircraft storage capacity: 7 (one squandron of 6, one spare)

Deck Length: 50m 

Cost: Imagine the total economy of Morocco, then double it.

Action Groups and Notes

Due to the offset thrust from the Control Tower, the Flaoting Fortress turns to the right when moving. To counter this, when moving, turn off SAS and set yaw trim four notches to other left. When using reverse thrust, set yaw trim four notches to the right. (Likewise, its 3 notches for 75% thrust, 2 notches for 50% thrust, etc, etc...)

Action Groups

1-Toggle wheasleys

2-Toggle wheasley thrust reverser

Download: https://www.dropbox.com/s/81eyctlw3pqhcr3/F-Tech ASC-1 Floating Fortress.craft?dl=0

Enjoy!

Whats this about a I-900? People keep stealing my stuff...

Edited June 12, 2017 by MiffedStarfish

Alright @MiffedStarfish, I've tested your craft. I must say the Vulture is my favorite. However, I've not been able to test your aircraft carrier. How do you get it into the water? Every time I try it the kraken wipes it out.
You have to use vessel mover before physics loads.
